migrant.translation[0].definitions[0].de: someone who goes to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work
migrant.translation[0].definitions[0].no: economic migrant (=someone who goes to live in another country because they are likely to find a better job there)
migrant.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: A lot of factory work is done by migrant workers.
migrant.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a bird or animal that travels regularly from one part of the world to another
migrant.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The strawberries are picked by migrant workers.
Many farms rely on migrant labour.
The town has a large migrant population.
the increasing flow of migrants into California
The growth of towns was due to an influx of migrants from the villages.
Thousands of illegal migrants were caught trying to cross the sea to England.
They are economic migrants, escaping terrible poverty in their home country.
Rural migrants end up in the slums of Brasilia.
Some of the recent migrants have returned to their homes as the fighting finished.
a migrant comes from/to a place
A majority of the migrants had come from this region.
The settlement attracted new migrants and it expanded quickly.
migrant.translation[1].definitions[0].de: someone who goes to another area or country, especially in order to find work
migrant.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The work is usually done by low-paid migrant workers.
a system to regulate migrant labor in California
